October 29th, 2009, 11:48 am· ·posted by Nancy Luna, Staff Writer
In a phone interview today, Costco’s Chief Financial Officer Richard Galanti addressed consumer concerns about the chain’s new policy to accept food stamps at its 407 locations.
He also laid out a time frame for starting the program at Costco, which operate 12 warehouses in Orange County.
Galanti said Costco must get regulatory approval to accept food stamps in each state. Each location must get a separate approval, as well. The goal, he said, is to have all 407 warehouses accepting food stamps by the end of the year.
Costco already accepts food stamps at a San Diego-area warehouse in El Centro. It should take“only a few weeks”before more California Costcos get approval, he said. Locally, the move should help the increasing number of people receiving food assistance.
In Orange County, 134,965 people received food stamps in August, a 22 percent increase compared to the same month in 2008, said Terry Lynn, a spokeswoman for the county’s Social Services agency. (see more food aid data below)
Galanti said the company’s decision to accept food stamps has received mostly positive feedback from consumers. Still, he addressed customer concerns during our talk:
Q: Some customers say accepting food stamps will make wait-times even longer at the register. True? A: Galanti said people on government aid don’t have individual food stamps for various food items. Instead, they use a single debit-style card to swipe at the checkout stand. Cash registers deduct the value of the card from the total, and then the customer pays the difference. So there are only two transactions that occur.
“We don’t see it as a slowdown,”Galanti said, referring to test markets in El Centro and New York.“It’s a smooth process.”
Warehouses to accept food stamps.
Q: Can food stamps be applied to membership fees, and non-food items such as big screen TVs? A: No.
Q: How many food-stamp eligible items does Costco sell? A: Of the 4,000 items we sell in stores—from tires to mayonnaise—about half are eligible, he said. In fact, Galanti said“most every food item”in the store is eligible.
Q: How many members do yo have? And, of those, what percentage are on food stamps? A: We have 30 million members worldwide, and 25 million in the U.S.“I don’t know”how many of those are on food stamps.
More on food assistance: According to recent data , food stamp assistance is at an all-time high with 36 million receiving aid. In California, Orange, Los Angeles and San Diego counties were recently dubbed“high need”regions for food assistance, according to a report by state health officials. In Orange County, food stamp use in August was up 22 percent, compared to August 2008. The average amount of aid given, per person, in Orange County is $145.14.*
Tell us: What do you think of Costco’s new food stamp policy? Cast your vote here .
*assistance given varies and is based on several factors, including housing costs, number of people per household and income.
Northwest Wall and Ceiling Bureau’s Annual Convention and Trade Show: May 10-12, Coeur d’Alene Resort, Coeur d’Alene, Idaho.(2007 CONVENTION COMPANION)
Walls&Ceilings April 1, 2007 The Northwest Wall and Ceiling Bureau’s annual Convention&Trade Show will be held May 10 to 12 at the Coeur d’Alene Golf&Spa Resort, in Coeur d’Alene, Idaho. The theme of this year’s event is“Set the Sails!”Attendees will enjoy educational programs, informative exhibits, important industry meetings and great tours and golf while experiencing a spectacular lakeside location about 40 minutes east of Spokane, Wash. go to website coeur d alene resort
If you haven’t been to Coeur d’Alene recently, you will find that the city has grown tremendously and the Coeur d’Alene Resort is grander than ever. The resort has just made significant investments to upgrade the property, including the addition of a world-class spa, top-to-bottom renovation of the guest rooms, complete redecoration of the conference center and lobby, and extensive upgrades to the infamous Coeur d’Alene Golf Course.
The convention starts off Thursday morning with men’s and women’s golf tournaments at the Coeur d’Alene Golf Course. In addition to golf, groups can head out on a speedboat-and-bicycle tour, horseback riding excursion or a scenic lunch cruise on Lake Coeur d’Alene.
The official convention agenda begins later Thursday afternoon with the Opening Ceremonies and the 2007 Outstanding Project of the Year Awards showcase. Keynote speaker Carrie Stuart Parks, a fine artist and a forensic artist and investigator, will deliver a fascinating and entertaining presentation on memory–how we forget and remember. The Trade Show begins immediately following the opening session with the President’s Welcoming Party.
Friday morning begins with industry-segment meetings for the delegates while the spouses get an invigorating start for the day with a yoga class. The exhibit hall hosts a breakfast event, after which there will be a seminar on load-bearing steel framing for attendees and area architects. At the same time, there will be an intriguing seminar by Parks on how to evaluate personal communication and determine if you are being told the truth. This program is followed by a session titled“Hidden Risks&Liabilities of Electronic Records,”presented by Seattle Attorney Jim Yand of Stafford Frey Cooper. this web site coeur d alene resort
[ILLUSTRATION OMITTED] While the technical forums for interior and exterior topics are going on Friday afternoon, the spouses have a rare opportunity to learn sushi-making hands-on with the chef at Bonsai Garden.
Friday will wrap up with the anticipated manufacturer- and dealer-sponsored party at the golf course. Guests can put their tee-shots to the test at the floating green, enjoy a great buffet dinner and dancing in a large, comfortable tent, or sit at a bonfire on the beach. The only theme of this year’s party is“Fun”–attendees are invited to come as they are to this refreshing social event.
Saturday morning brings everyone to the trade show for one final opportunity to see the exhibits and to make and renew vital industry contacts. After breakfast in the exhibit hall, attendees can choose from two powerful seminars:“Succession Planning for Wall and Ceiling Businesses,”presented by Dan Gaffney, CPA, of Moss Adams LLP, and“Effective Project Management,”by Dr. Gerry Williams of R. Brown Consulting Group LLC.
The NWCB Annual Meeting is scheduled for 11:30 a.m. on Saturday. The afternoon includes technical sessions on exterior sealants and computer-aided evaluation of labor productivity and an informal, non-sanctioned group ride for motorcycle enthusiasts organized by a group of delegates. Finally, the convention will wrap up with a reception and a closing banquet with dinner, entertainment and the anticipated presentation of the Industry Person of the Year Award.
The convention is built around an informative trade show, where all the latest products, tools, systems and services are displayed. The exhibitors and delegates get an opportunity to meet face to face during the effective exhibit hours, with no competing events on the schedule.
Coeur d’Alene is a destination that the whole family can enjoy, and spouses and families are welcome at the convention. Special programs have been organized for the spouses.
For more information on the convention, call NWCB at (800) 524-4215 or visit www.nwcb.org. Registration forms and online registration are now available on the association’s Web site.
